text.0: i sing a lofty song for she is mightiest most divine of streams.
text.1: sarasvatī will i exalt with hymns and lauds and o vasiṣṭha heaven and earth.
text.2: when in the fulness of their strength the pūrus dwell beauteous one on thy two grassy banks.
text.3: favour us thou who hast the maruts for thy friends stir up the bounty of our chiefs.
text.4: so may sarasvatī auspicious send good luck she rich in spoil is never niggardly in thought.
text.5: when praised in jamadagnis way and lauded as vasiṣṭha lauds.
text.6: we call upon sarasvān as unmarried men who long for wives.
text.7: as liberal men who yearn for sons.
text.8: be thou our kind protector o sarasvān with those waves of thine.
text.9: laden with sweets and dropping oil.
text.10: may we enjoy sarasvāns breast allbeautiful that swells with streams.
text.11: may we gain food and progeny.
